data.question: What is the maximum temperature up to which most porous MOFs can be heated without losing their framework integrity?
What method was used to improve the thermal stability of porous MOFs?
What is the thermal stability temperature of the Yb MOF reported in the text?
Why did initial attempts to use sulfates to bridge the doubly interpenetrated, (8,3)-connected nets in PCN-9 fail?
data.answer: Due to the limited coordination number of the cobalt center and the need for additional counterions to balance the overall charge.

data.question: What is the formula of PCN-17?
What is the estimated surface area of activated PCN-17 according to the CO2 adsorption isotherm?
What gas does PCN-17 selectively adsorb over N2 and CO?
Is the thermal stability of PCN-17 higher than that of most porous MOFs?
Can PCN-17 maintain its framework integrity at very high temperatures even after guest removal?
Does PCN-17 adsorb N2 effectively?
Is the pore size of PCN-17 increased by the presence of sulfate bridging ligands?
Does PCN-17 exhibit selective adsorption of O2 over N2 due to its small pore size?
Was PCN-17 synthesized using a solvothermal method?
What is the role of the sulfate anions in PCN-17?
data.answer: They act as bridging ligands between two Yb4(m4-H2O) clusters.

data.question: What is the space group of PCN-17?
What is the estimated pore volume for PCN-17?
Does the structure of PCN-17 allow for the selective adsorption of gases based on their kinetic diameters?
What is the significance of the coordinatively linked interpenetrated framework in PCN-17?
data.answer: It contributes to the exceptionally high thermal stability of PCN-17.

data.question: What is the main advantage of PCN-17's selective gas-adsorption capability?
data.answer: It may have applications for the separation of nitrogen and oxygen, the separation of hydrogen from carbon monoxide in fuel-cell applications, and the hydrogen enrichment of the N2/H2 exhaust in ammonia synthesis.

data.question: Was the synthesis of PCN-17 successful on the first attempt with sulfates as bridging ligands?
